title: Great Service
body: Friendly and efficient appointment with the practice nurse. I continue to be impressed with the quality of service provided by the practice in the context of chronic underfunding and increasing demand.

title: Great place to be registered
body: I have been fortunate enough to have been registered at this practice for 25 years, there is nothing negative I can write about Shoreditch Surgery.

title: Brilliant attention
body: Called an ambulance today to beckwith Rd inHarrogate 2 ambulance ladies attended Very impressed Our friend had fallen out of bed and injured her arm and shoulder   The girls gave her the medical attention required and left !  Thanks very much for care and attention

title: Extremely modern, clean and efficient
body: Recently visited Grafton Medical Partners (Trevelyan House Surgery) for a booster COVID vaccination. Whole experience very well organised, friendly and efficient. This is the NHS at its very best,

title: Great practice and a great experience
body:
I telephoned for an appointment to see the GP and my call was answered without being placed into a queue.  I was told that I would receive a telephone call that same morning, which duly happened.  I received a text message and was asked to send a photo image and on completion of that request, was given a face to face appointment.
When I arrived at the surgery my wait was minimal and on seeing the GP, was duly advised and treated.
Whilst there I asked the GP if they preferred this new approach and was told that it allows them to see more patients on a daily basis.
Well it doesn’t get better than that, does it.
My experience was perfect and I cannot thank my GP enough for making the whole process so easy and convenient.
I have been with this practice since a child so have seen many changes over the years and have always recommended to my friends and colleagues.
I would like to say a big thank you

title: Good practice, would recommend
body: Very easy to register via Dr iq app rather than with printed forms and rental contracts. Over the last year I have never had a problem getting an appointment, within one week for simple contraception and within one day for pain. The staff are very thorough and knowledgeable, if not particularly friendly, but certainly no rudeness, just efficiency and I can appreciate that in these times of under funding.

title: Hip replacement brilliant
body: Wow, I couldn't have expected any better service, care, treatment and total professionalism from the very beginning at chase Farm. From security, to registration, operation, recovery and stay Amazing.  Everywhere is spotless, presentable.  The staff are very approachable, caring, attentive and have a plan to routine.  Cannot knock the dedication each and every staff member has shown so far.  6 star service on the nhs.

title: 5 star service
body: Childrens A&E - We were booked in and seen quickly (possibly due to the nature of the visit). The staff were friendly, reassuring and kept us informed. We were there for 3 hours and even got a cup of tea. My son and I were very pleased with the treatment and diagnosis provided and felt very well cared for by all the staff involved. We left saying we had a 5 star service. Thank you.

title: Excellent Communication Given
body:
Communication skills so important for patients experiencing the unknown with their health.
I received first class information and time to answer questions I have needed answered.

title: Exemplary treatment
body: I came to the hospital yesterday because a dog had bitten my hand.  I was seen promptly and had excellent treatment and was most impressed with the whole experience. Thank you.

title: Horrendous
body: Changed GP after being with this local one for years and it's just gotten worse. Unable to get through even though I called right on the dot they requested. Once I get through some cocky staff member answers saying I can't pre book and to call back in the morning (even though they don't bloody pick up) also told me I could fill out an e consult but either the form was really hard to find or just simply wasn't there, their online bookings too say they aren't in use. It's shocking

title: Never any appointments
body: Every time I ring for an appointment they are always full. You have to ring at 8am to try get an appointment for that day and they will not allow you to book in advance for the next day, always told to call back tomorrow and when you do the appointments are gone.

title: Professionalism and Respectful Surgery
body: Only joined Recently but found the surgery very professional staff very understanding and Its already Helping me while i go about trying to Help my Health thanks ! keep up the good work.

title: Understanding staff
body: Staff went above and beyond to help me. Phone calls returned after sorting queries for us. So very polite and understanding.

title: Poor processes - it’s hard to get an appointment
body:
I am usually not one to leave reviews like this but the process to book appointments is appalling. You must ring at 08:15 or 14:00 and even then, appointments may all be gone by the time you get through. I’m particularly baffled as the receptionists still insist that you call at these times even when the surgery has contacted you to make an appointment regardless of the severity of the ongoing situation. Why they removed online booking is beyond me! That was a much simpler method of securing an appointment and could be booked in advance instead of the mad scramble to try and get in there before everyone else. I’ve had receptionists quiz me about my symptoms only to tell me to call back later. Not a good system at all. 

It’s a shame because the GPs (when you get to see them) are very professional and obviously care about their patients.

title: Admin/reception staff are rude
body:
Working in the reception/administration team must be very challenging, but if the doctors, nurses and Ha's at Killick Street can treat patients well (as they always have done in my experience) I am sure the practice can put in measures to ensure this happens consistently at reception. Then it would be a fantastic practice. There are many challenges facing primary care currently, but being rude to patients (& there are a number of other reviews on here where people have been left in tears) isn't going to make anyone's life better. I now dread ringing or sending in a request and avoid contact if at all possible, due to multiple instances of rudeness. There seems to an attitude that the whole place would run much better without the patients! 
A change of culture is needed. Please consider additional training for staff.

title: Very good practice
body:
Attended for Cataract operation, all staff very welcoming & pleasant,
theater staff very attentive, surgeon kept me informed of what was happening, very good experience

title: Great practice
body: I had my second eye surgery on 17th of this month. All the staff were very caring and efficient.  They looked after me very well. This is day 5 since my operation and it is wonderful to be able to see so well, it is early days yet but I am so very pleased with the operation. Many thanks to all of you.

title: Good service and care given the circumstances
body: Given that GPS everywhere are working under enormous pressure with inadequate resources I think the Hollies is doing well. I generally can get appointments, staff including reception, are helpful, kind and trying to do their best. Going above and beyond to help resolve issues in many cases. Wait times for routine appointments and lack of of joined up care is frustrating but my impression is that is a symptom of wider systemic issues and chronic underfunding of the NHS over the last decade compounded by Covid, rather than a failing on the part of staff at the surgery.

title: eConsult what a waste of time
body:
Why does Rainbow Medical operate eConsult.
As a patient your continuously told to use eConsult first before phoning.  Yet your eConsult service only ever operates Monday to Friday 7am to 9am so what exactly is the point of it?

Are health issues only a Monday to Friday between 7am - 9am issue, No they are a 24/7 issues for the public.

Suggest Rainbow Medical do some serious reorganization of there eConsult service to provide better patient care an outcomes.   Most GP providers providing a eConsult service during the full operating hours of GP practice with a number of providers facilitating a 24/7 eConsult submission.  Rainbow Medical definitely needs to look at best practices from these surgery's and improve your services drastically.

title: Unhelpful and unreliable reception staff
body: I called at 7.45 to get a telephone appt with GP for advice.  Phone service said all operators busy and call back, then disconnected me.  I called 10 times in a row.  At 8 am I went to surgery in person.  I could see staff inside.  At 8.15 the door was not unlocked yet, with a queue of people outside.  I rang the reception bell and asked if GP opened at 8 - receptionist said yes and I said, it's 8.15.  She then asked what I wanted ignoring my comment.  She told me they don't take in person appointments and I would have to call.  I then kept trying appt line and still getting disconnected.  I then called back and tried option '5' for general enquiries.  I was on hold for one hour.  Was I got through, I was told all appts were gone and that I had to call back next day.  I replied that I specifically stayed late this morning from work to make this appt.  The receptionist just kept repeating to call back next day.  There was no care or understanding.  I'm extremely frustrated and will be looking to change practices.  Do not register here if you are thinking about it!

title: Amazing practice
body: I have been with the surgery for only 3 years and can honestly say that all of the staff are incredible! From reception staff to pharmacist, nurse and GP. Always extremely helpful, friendly, informative and professional. I feel extremely lucky to be part of this practice. Unfortunately I've had to contact them a few times in the last 6 months and have been so impressed with the care, especially during these difficult times. Absolute credit to the profession.

title: Good availability
body: I have always found that booking an appointment is very easy. No matter what time I have contacted the surgery, they have found an available appointment very quickly.

title: Very good practice
body: I usually go to Croft medical centre Sydenham, I found this receptionist really friendly at lyle court, and was treated very well by the doctor.

title: Extremely Helpful if Genuinely Ill
body: I continue to need regular assistance from Folly Lane Medical Centre and I have always been able to talk to a doctor despite the straight jacket protocol they now have to work under. The telephone has always been an issue, but the triage system is necessary to protect the scant resources available. The care I receive is worth a lengthy telephone wait !

title: 5* Service
body:
My wife and I have been with this Practice for 13 years. During this time we have had reason to visit the surgery, or request home service, on numerous occasions. We have a designated family doctor but are able to consult any other doctor in the Practice, which we have done when necessary. Thank you to all doctors, practice nurses and others who have given us great service and care all these years.
Presently we have a friend, from Yorkshire, , staying with us who has suffered a reoccurrence of a water infection. Her own doctor declined to send her an electronic prescription because she was “out of area “. Thankfully our surgery acted promptly and enrolled her as a temporary patient. One of our doctors then used the NHS computer system to review her medical file, sent an electronic prescription to our local pharmacy and enabled us to collect the necessary antibiotic pills within less than two hours. That’s what you call 5* Service. That’s the service we are used to. Medical Trusts in North East Yorkshire should take note.

title: Excellent service
body: I attended the practice and was greeted by a receptionist who was extremely helpful, she helped me with my issues and couldn’t do enough. I was really nervous coming to the practice but I was made to feel at ease.

title: Great practice
body: Got appointment straight away booking through online traige. The doctor that treated me was very a Friendly doctor! Within 3 mins of booking online form i got a text back

title: Fantastic gp
body: I had a telephone appointment that had been arranged by the doctor 2 weeks before.  He was very thorough made sure I was ok and made sure I was ok with everything we had spoken about before I left.

title: Best practice for miles
body:
I have been a patient for 14 years now & always found the advice & treatment I needed at the time.
Excellent service all round

title: Absolutely outstanding
body: I transferred to Kings a couple of months ago he to moving house. The process from registering at the surgery was seamless and the staff were so helpful. I have had my first appointment today and every single stage was just so easy and stress free. From the telephone lines and options, to actually booking the appointment, and today attending the surgery from check in and treatment. My appointment was on time which I was not used to at my previous practice, I was offered a chaperone for my assessment, and all staff greeted me with smiles and were obviously very knowledgable and great at their jobs. I feel in good hands at Kings and think other surgeries could learn a lot from their processes and the way their staff treat patients with dignity and respect.

title: Good practice
body: Unusually, the receptionist that attended to me was very helpful and the practice nurses are always very friendly and welcoming. The doctors have always been quick to react/respond and you never feel like you're being rushed out of the door.  It's sometimes difficult to get an appointment but that's the same all over the country.

title: Outstanding service
body: Every member of staff (Neck of Femur, A ward 5) were: kind, caring, helpful and professional. I could not fault them.

title: Good practice
body: My problem was dealt with by the receptionist very quickly and efficiently. I would recommend this practice to deal with any problems.

title: Always excellent
body: Have been a patient at Wokingham Medical Centre for 7 years, and have two children. We have never struggled to speak to a doctor when we need to. The econsult is fantastic - I had a reply from a doctor within 6 minutes! My child saw a doctor within 2 hours and got medication, which prevented us going to a&e. Absolutely fantastic practice. Thank you for working so hard, and being so friendly and caring. Always going above and beyond. Highly recommend to everyone.

title: Very efficient service
body:
Went for my covid booster last night.
Everything ran lick clockwork . Everyone was polite & happy to assist

title: Excellent Staff
body:
I was admitted for a gynae operation. The two dedicated nurses were excellent - friendly reassuring. 
I have had a problem with anaesthetic previously and it was in my notes that I was to have the procedure done in the main operating theatres.
However the Anaesthetist said after full discussion and reassurance that he could do it safely and I put my trust I him.
All went well.
The Gynaecologist explained the operation. She also listened to me and answered my questions. Again I was reassured.
The whole team were kind and caring. I have no problem in recommending the Day Surgical Unit. Thank you to you all. Marina Turnbull

title: Great practice
body: Friendly and efficient. On arrival I had forgotten my mask but one free one was on the window sill awaiting me. I filled in the arrival screen which was straight forward. The receptionist was helpful and courteous. The nurse was friendly and professional. I was out quickly and happily on my way home.

title: Good organisation
body: Sign in was quick and easy. I received my vaccinations on time. The health professional was courteous, informative and respectful.

title: Top class practice
body: You could not have done any better polite and helpful from reception to doctors it is good to see I was made to feel at ease well done

title: Very efficient service
body:
Went for my covid booster last night.
Everything ran lick clockwork . Everyone was polite & happy to assist

title: Great practice
body: Nurse was really kind and welcoming. The nurse explained everything properly. She also explained what we have to do next.

title: Sorted me out
body:
Booked a telephone appointment for 2 weeks time. Phone call on time, went for face to face examination the next day. Hospital appointment arranged promptly, after hospital visit had a phone call and tablets arranged for pick up for same day.
Was very satisfied with the service

title: Excellent
body: Thank you so much for your kind and professional care. Also for the clear explanation and understanding of my situation.

title: Great treatment
body: I attended A&E with my mother who had injured her arm.  She was assessed, sent for x-rays, reassured and sent home.  She said the three x-ray girls were absolutely fantastic, friendly, professional, and when she was assessed in A&E, although she was extremely anxious, she was made to feel at ease and reassured.

title: Just Amazing
body: No Matter my query the practice always help me out. My family and I have a great relationship with the admin to team to the GP and the nurses. The best practice I have ever been at and I couldn't be happier

title: Brilliant help re a Dermatology referral process.
body:
My GP had referred me appropriately to Dermatology at local Acute Hospital Trust. Following confused info and differing Out Patient appointment offers from that hospital, an amazing secretary at my GP surgery was able to sort the problem, and twice phoned me to confirm what would happen next. 
Hugely grateful, and this helped my peace of mind so much.
A brilliant GP practice in all aspects of its care.

title: Wonderful team
body: Endoscopy unit excellent staff friendly and professional. From the booking team to the nursing professional staff.

title: Wonderful experience with GP
body:
I would like to write to thank the GP who saw my 3 year old daughter today. She took great care to put my daughter at ease and even let my daughter take her own swab with some help so she didn’t feel scared. I was really impressed with how she interacted with my daughter and involved her in her questions. My daughter was apprehensive coming into the appointment and left saying ‘That wasn’t sore mummy! It was fine!’ 

My experience with the practice nurse at this surgery has often been less than ideal due to their rather abrupt nature but my experience with this GP was commendable. Thank you!

title: Considerate support
body: Ashbourne have been caring for my father who has a life shortening condition. He was told that he only had a few weeks left but thank fully he is still with us and being cared for and supported by the gentle Ashbourne carers. Each one of them has been fantastic and very considerate to him and to us. Thank you.

title: Super care..
body:
Super care received yesterday as a day patient in Day Surgery 1
Thank you to everyone for all your care & support you all work super hard even when short staffed - always give the extra mile
Thank you🤗
Julie Rutter

title: Extremely helpful and caring
body: Yesterday gave me great comfort with the caring service I received from the secretary and GP who went that extra mile to help me. I was treated with great compassion from my first phonecall for advice through to seeing the GP the same day.

title: A beacon of success!
body: This practice has been absolutely fantastic in providing all the medical care that I have needed, over the tough times of the coronavirus pandemic and more recently.  I have always been able to make contact with the practice when needed, via econsult or telephone and on all occasions   a face to face consultation has been offered where appropriate to my need.The staff,without exception,  have treated me with care and compassion. I could not ask for more from this practice and consider it to be a beacon of success.

title: Nurse Appointment
body:
I saw one of the practice nurses and the appointment was good.
The nurse was very friendly and courteous.
More importantly the sample taking of blood was painless😀.

title: Knowledgeable and helpful doctors
body:
I am very grateful for the care I have received recently. I have recently suffered with both physical and mental health problems which needed treatment from a GP. They were kind, caring, knew their stuff, and acted swiftly. I would highly recommend their practice to anyone in the area. 
It can be difficult to get an appointment as the app doesn't work and you can't book appointments on line. The reception is busy, and the staff always on the phones. However, they are very polite and get you booked in as swiftly as they can. I didn't want to go into details about my health with the person I last spoke to, and they were very understanding.

title: Medication review
body: I suffer with Adult ADHD and anxiety which makes simple things very stressful and can be an anxious time for me, all I can say is that the staff and Dr's are not mind readers, if you explain to them you are struggling they will help you and treat you kindly and go out of their way to resolve your issues.  I know this from experience, so thank you all the staff and doctors in a very stressful and overstretched time

title: We can’t praise the staff enough.
body:
We have spent a combined 16 weeks at Birmingham Childrens Hospital this year alone following our sons surgeries, with a great deal of that spent on Ward 11. Although all of the care we have received has been phenomenal, the staff on ward 11 are by far the best. They are a fantastic team of close knit nurses and doctors, expertly organised by the ward sister.
The attention to detail on patient care, the kindness and consideration given to parents is nothing short of amazing.
From the housekeepers to the nursing staff, there is very little that we could pick fault with ward 11. 
The only thing that could improve this already amazing ward, is additional funding for a refurbishment.

readBy.name: Birmingham Women's and Children's NHS Foundation Trust

title: Still waiting and fully booked
body: I suffer with depression and a multitude of other medical issues and which after hospital appointments I was referred back to see the GP, 6 weeks ago I got called to do with my results for my blood test to do with my B12 and thyroid and was told that they would call me back in a couple of days to get an appointment to see the doctor to discuss my results and 6 weeks later I'm still waiting. I tried calling them and was told they were fully booked and to try again later. With my depression I should be getting a review every 3 to 6 months to look at my medication the only time it's been discussed in the 11 years I've been on the same medication is when I have brought it up only to be told that it was the best one out there, but im afraid ive become immune to it like my last one. I'm meant to have a chest xray once a year because I have COPD and I only get one if I ask for it. I need to see an actual GP to discuss everything and try and get my medical issues sorted but it's impossible to get an actual appointment. The only doctor that seems to chase anything up with me is the ears nose and throat from the hospital but that doesn't help with everything else that needs sorting. I don't advise anyone with any actual existing issues to join this surgery as you won't get dealt with.

title: I had colonoscopy
body: I suffer from extreme anxiety and the nurses and the staff make me feeling very relaxed and after i had my mild sedation which really should off not had as i am still groggy day 2! Apart from that I recommend this clinic

readBy.name: Mid and South Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Well Looked after
body:
The last nine months I had  two cancers appear separate times. The head doctor at Woodsetton Medical Centre  wasted no time and got things in motion very quickly with all the hospitals involved. 
Communication to myself from Woodsetton , excellent . Was kept updated and supported all the way.
Massive Thank You to all involved at this well organised medical centre.

title: Not patient focused
body:
Very long wait on telephone to make an appointment.
Not enough receptionists.
Closed Wednesday afternoons.
When I did go into surgery to make an appointment,
I was offered one at a different surgery miles away.
What’s going on with the Cheadle Medical practice ?
I would like continuity. Every time I go , I see a different GP. Huge waiting time to see the most respected GPs

title: vary good service.
body: West hoe surgery I find always vary helpful I can always get an appointment and also get my prescriptions when I need them. Vary happy with surgery and feel lucky.

title: Awful phone consultation
body: Couldn't book on the app because "no available appointments at this time" or any time. Called the automated service to be told no appointment available and then cut off. This took 20 mins of being sent in circles. Called 111 in the end and got a telephone appointment with a rude doctor who didn't seek at all interested in my issue that has been long standing and very concerning. I'm very disappointed to have spoken to in such a rude manner about a sensitive matter. If the call was recorded,  please take note of how little I was able to say due the ongoing badgering by the doctor who kept saying that I needed to call a specialist as the practice is GP only. By the way, the specialist had rold me to contact the GP! If you become a doctor,  surely speaking with some level of kindness is part of the role? I will be moving to another practice

title: Outstanding service
body: I visited A&E last night with my four year old son with stomach pains, and I cannot fault the level of service we received from every single member of staff. Everyone was friendly, attentive, knowledgeable and caring. My son was scared of everyone he came across which made assessing his situation more difficult, but everyone was calm, patient and friendly towards him. The relevant tests were completed as straightforward as possible, and information and updates were provided to me clearly and in a timely manner. We were at the hospital for around 6 hours in the end but weren't kept waiting unnecessarily. I cannot thank you enough for seeing us and I am so proud of the service we received - thank you all.

title: Great Practice
body: I called the surgery to book a telephone consultation with regards to an on-going problem. Was booked in for just over 2 weeks later, which as it wasn't an emergency, I feel is acceptable. On the day of the appointment, had a conversation with the doctor, which was not rushed and who listened to me. It was agreed that I tried a different type of medication. Doctor sent through the request to my pharmacist on the same day and medication picked up the same day too!  That's what I call fantastic service!

title: Polite and courteous receptionists
body: Receptionists were extremely polite and arranged an appointment later that day, after a 5minute wait on hold. The fact that they manage to remain professional and courteous despite the amount of abuse they seem to get, should be commended! Somehow people seem to think the high number of calls they receive is their fault..!

title: Not a scratch on what it was!
body: Long wait for an appointment to see a doctor, four weeks wait for a telephone call from a doctor. Visit the surgery - the place is very quiet with little activity

title: appalling
body:
i recently received an email from the NHS telling me i can book a covid booster, after going through the online booking form it told me i do not need to book a covid booster !!! ( no i haven't already had one ).The form said to find out why contact my GP. i tried to do so and After listening to a  recorded message around 3 minutes long containing nothing relevant to the reason for my call, I then get a recorded menu with 4 options, none of which were relevant to the reason for my call, after selecting the option which was closest to why i was calling the message told me a mumbled amount of people which was not understandable are in the queue and the estimated wait time is 80 Mns !.Its 10.30 Am on a Thursday !.
   They obviously know you are not going to wait on the phone, and clearly do not wish to speak to anybody, so design the answer system so that you'll not bother .What is everybody doing there.....is any body there ?.
   I noticed that all the reviews on this page are un answed,i expect this one will join the list .Disgraceful service .

title: Always the best!
body:
Great staff, fantastic doctors, easy book appointments, the best of care, what more can one ask for?
You couldn't ask for better care, no hanging about for appointments, 
and all the time you need to deal with your problems. 
So  many grumble about GP services generally, but I couldn't find a fault no matter how hard I looked.
Thank you to all the staff at the surgery for giving us their time and such excellent care, and thanks to our brilliant doctors.

title: This surgery
body: Over the years I have had very good service . However since The Pandemic, appointments for a face to face with a doctor are nigh on impossible as I'm sure you are aware. It is as usual, difficult to telephone through . When I do see a doctor they are usually spot on.

title: Covid/flu vaccinations
body: First morning so a little chaotic but settled and sorted smallish reception area anyway. However very quick to deal with the actual vaccination and all staff calm and pleasant

title: Covid and Flu Boosters
body:
All well organised, running to appointed time.
All necessary details and checks verified in a pleasant and efficient 
manner.

title: Covid booster and flu jabs
body: Attended for my jabs to Cheadle Medical.  Easy on-line booking system - waited 10 mins, big queue but this moved very quickly.

title: Very organised and efficient practice.
body: Received a message to book my Covid Autumn booster in the morning and booked a slot for that evening. Friendly, quick and easy.

title: no appointments
body: to book an appointment is almost impossible. used to be so good ,now one of the worst why?can only book online, no appointments for weeks or not at all not good enough

title: Staff sitting in a do not sit area
body: Your Cleaner is sitting in chairs when waiting room full and I have high anxiety so couldn’t enter and there’s a section of seats ‘reserved/blocked’ and as a parent I have to wait to be seen with my child and stand up yet these staff are adamant these chairs can’t be sat in, I will be complaining to PALS about this as it’s totally unacceptable as I don’t wanna talk in front of everyone explaining why I can’t go in waiting area as it’s not everybody’s business!! Tell staff to stand up if we as patients/parents have to stand up!!

title: Well organized
body: Received text inviting me for my next Covid jab. Applied and got an appointment for that evening, which was very well run. I was in and out in double quick time, and no jab pain at all. So as first visit very impressed.

title: Brilliant service at the Breast Unit
body: Seamless triple assessment of a breast concern, extremely thorough, felt I could ask as many questions as I needed to and great care given.

readBy.name: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing staff
body: Today I went for my annual check up at chest clinic and I’ve been going here for three years and right from day one of my condition, the staff and my consultant are amazing and so caring and understanding. Everyone needs a medal. I can’t thank everyone enough. Thank you from the bottom of my heart. Xx

title: Great practice
body: Visited for flu and COVID booster vaccinations.  A bit busy (to be expected) but well organised, and a further enquiry requiring the help of reception was dealt with efficiently and with a friendly and pleasant manner.

title: Death of what was once a great service
body:
I have had several unrelated issues and tests done, not once has anyone advised me of the results.  After many calls, and not being able to get through I gave up with the phone and went to the surgery. The receptionist gave me the results (obviously I Had Questions for the GP) no appointment was offered and I had to take pot luck ringing each day at 8pm, only to be given a telephone appointment with a nurse practitioner nearly two weeks later.  Fed up with it all.  I am sure the one and only receptionist manning the phone and desk is too!!!! Today I have been buttoned once and left holding for 8 minutes before the phone cut off again. Hence the review. 

Also why are you able to leave a message for the GP on the app when ordering medication to find nothing has answered, the response I was given was "oh we don't look at those messages". ?????????

All faith gone.  Never mind I'll make another cuppa.

title: Friendly
body: I always find the staff at Cheadle Medical Practice friendly and helpful. The reception staff are sometimes difficult to get through to, but always phone me when I select the call back option. The staff are always prepared to do all they can, to help put me in touch with the correct GP, when they can, & as soon as they can. I recently attended clinic for my Flu & Covid Booster vaccines. There was a very short wait, but, again, the nurse was friendly & I am was leaving the Surgery perhaps 5 minutes after my appointment time.

title: Shocking
body:
This practice used to be wonderful until around three years ago. Since then a steady decline in the ability to see a doctor, talk to anyone other than front desk and lack of any dialogue is disgusting.
I recently spent the best part of a year sick from work for mental health and never once saw a medical professional from this surgery, I only received three brief phone calls in this time.
More recently medical paperwork has been lost, no apology, no explanation just "it's been lost"

Steer clear is my advice

title: Very supportive re mental health
body: I have seen a few doctors and they have been incredibly supportive and helpful - which is incredibly important when you are experiencing mental health issues. I have never felt rushed or not listened too. They have shown great compassion and very helpful strategies to deal with this.

title: Awful service
body: My son has recently come out of hospital with Paediatric wheeze discharge plan. This plan states that he needs a GP review on day 2 of his plan. Trying to book one has been impossible. I must call at either 8:30 am for a morning appointment or 2pm for an afternoon appointment. Both of these times are when I'm working. There is absolutely no way of booking otherwise. This is an awful way to run a health care service.

title: horrible system in place
body:
it is extremely difficult to get an appointment 
 the system says appointments can be given only at 8 am or 1 pm , but whenever we try calling it is always busy as everyone is trying to call at the same time for appointment .. why cant they take phone calls on other times and give appointments ?? even if that means appointment for  next day or any other available slot

title: A whole new world!
body: I received my cataract surgery at the Watford clinic and from referral to assessment to surgery took only 3 weeks.The reception staff were welcoming,warm,helpful and professional.The member of theatre staff with whom I mainly interacted was also warm and put me completely at ease (well,as much as possible because I was very nervous).The surgeon was friendly and reassuring,I felt virtually no discomfort and the result of the operation was nothing short of miraculous : I had not realised how much my sight had deteriorated but on the way home,peeping out of the side of my eye patch,the vivid colours and definition I could see were astonishing!.Since the op,I've had very little discomfort amd I look forward to having my other eye done.Thanks to all at SpaMedica Watford 🙏

title: Chaotic Flu Vaccination
body: I really wonder whether this medical practice is capable of organising anything efficiently. Apart from the usual inability to get a doctor’s appointment (in fact it is a very rare sight indeed to spot a doctor on the premises) the flu vaccination clinic was total chaos. The reception area was rammed with people and there were queues out of the door onto the street outside. It was so full that people were struggling to get inside to sign in and then having to join the queue outside again. There must be a better way.

title: Efficient service
body:
Very efficient service for my flu and Covid jabs
Booking was easy and although there was a bit of a queue when I arrived I was soon called through, about 10 minutes after my initial appointment. Very pleasant lady performed both jabs, one in each arm

title: Very efficient practice
body: After calling the surgery l got an appointment and saw the doctor within an hour, the doctor was very good after a test and examination he explained exactly what was happening and prescribed antibiotics, I left the practice feeling very reassured and happy, a very good visit with a very good doctor

title: Great service, efficient, clinically driven
body: I think the service here has been really fantastic. Online and by telephone. I have been listened to had my needs met in a timely and efficient manner. Thanks

title: Excellent service
body: My physio was always in time, to the point and listened to my needs. She then gave me exercises to do and explained so well that I had no questions to ask.

title: Awful Service
body: Found out I was pregnant at 5w and decided I couldn't go through with the pregnancy. Contacted MSI and was booked in for an appointment 12 days later. I was told this appointment would be with a nurse to discuss telemedicine, it wasn't. I had that appointment and then was booked in for another appointment two days later with the nurse (the appointment I thought I was going to have initially). Two hours passed the time I was supposed to be called and I still hadn't been contacted. I called MSI and was on hold for 40 minutes before I got through to someone. I was told when I eventually got through that they had tried to contact me but couldn't get through. My phone was on loud, I had signal and they definitely had the right number because they had got through successfully two days prior. I was then told all they could do was book me in for another two days time. I am now 8 weeks pregnant and incredibly distressed as it is impacting my mental health and daily life. Unfortunately this was the only provider that could see me as the other two were either at full capacity or I was out of their area to be seen. I am appaled by the way I have been treated and I am terrified that the same thing will happen again at my next appointment.

title: Great service, efficient, clinically driven
body: I think the service here has been really fantastic. Online and by telephone. I have been listened to had my needs met in a timely and efficient manner. Thanks

title: Poor
body: Called to book an appointment to get my implant removed. Got told there were no appointments at all and to call again as appointments are released randomly throughout the day. How am I supposed to know when to call back if it’s randomly released ? The next day? The next week? In two hours? Seems like I am just going to have to keep letting my implant make me ill indefinitely with no resolve. Receptionist was absolutely no help whatsoever and just hung up on me before I could even ask when I should call. Unacceptable. It’s not the first time I’ve been dismissed by a receptionist at this practice. I see many of the reviewers have had similar experiences.

title: Superb care from this entire team
body:
I was admitted for turp surgery at 07 am 12-9-2022 the whole experience was excellent from admission to pre operation checks by the nurse, the anaesthetist, the surgeon and all of the theatre staff.
The professional consideration shown was all about care, clearly the skills demonstrated by the whole surgical team was awesome.
I was similarly impressed by the dedicated professionalism of all grades in b14 critical and b20 where the whole experience related to my comfort and recovery. I simply cannot thank you all enough.

title: Vaccine delivery
body: Went for my flu and COVID booster vaccinations. Very well organised. In and out of the surgery. The text inviting me for the vaccines only mentioned the flu jab and not the covid booster, I therefore booked for the covid booster separately in Bramhall. Wasted appointment, as I found out that I could have both at Cheadle at the same time.

title: Brilliant  practice
body: The best practice I have ever been to. Always friendly, always helpful always trying to do its best for patients. No hesitation inn recommending this practice..

title: Very efficient
body: I received a text to ask if I wanted. 5 th Jab I said yes  I received the jab that evening , no queue just extremely efficient. In and out 5/10 minutes.  All complete.

title: Great Service and Effeciency
body:
Was very pleased with my visit to A&E walk in centre. It was very clean and they staff were very polite. I was seen very quickly and given the help I needed. Overall great experience and was there less than 1 hour. 

My only issue was the car park. It had half of it closed and was very hard to walk to the A&E department. This should be open with all spaces available. It’s too busy a hospital to have the car park partially closed. More parking is needed.

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust
